function.desc: The dependency graph address functions take a graph node as argument and navigates from this graph node to another graph node (if possible). There are seven dependency graph address functions:

subfunctions.subfunction: Returns the head of the graph node if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the leftmost (left) dependent of the graph node if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the rightmost (right) dependent of the graph node if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the next left (same-side) sibling of the graph node if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the next right (same-side) sibling of the graph node if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the predecessor of the graph node in the linear order of the input string if defined; otherwise, a null-value.
Returns the successor of the graph node in the linear order of the input string if defined; otherwise, a null-value.

function.name: InputColumn
function.desc: The column name must correspond to an input column in the data format and the address function must return a token node in the input string. (If the address function is undefined, a null-value is returned.)

function.name: OutputColumn
function.desc: The column name must correspond to an output column in the data format and the address function must return a graph node in the dependency graph. (If the address function is undefined, a null-value is returned.)

function.name: OutputTable
function.desc: This is a internal feature for MaltParser to address internal symbol table. (If the address function is undefined, a null-value is returned.)

function.name: Split
function.desc: Splits the feature value into a set of feature values. In addition to a feature specification it takes a delimiter (regular expression) as an argument.

function.name: Suffix
function.desc: Extract the suffix of a feature value with a suffix length n. By convention, if n = 0, the entire feature value is included; otherwise only the n last characters are included in the feature value.

function.name: Prefix
function.desc: Extract the prefix of a feature value with a prefix length n. By convention, if n = 0, the entire feature value is included; otherwise only the n first characters are included in the feature value.

function.name: Merge
function.desc: Merge two feature value into one feature value.

function.name: Merge3
function.desc: Merge three feature value into one feature value.
